p: In both years, the M-M treatment significantly improved grain yield compared with the Con.W-M treatment, which was based on current farmers’ practices, and achieved yield similar to that of the Opt.W-M treatment ( Fig. 3). Grain yields of the M-M treatment were 18.3 Mg ha −1 in 2013 and 20.9 Mg ha −1 in 2014, which were 31% and 14% higher, respectively, than the yields of the Con.W-M treatment.
